We are currently looking for a Web Developer who will be responsible for building and...","location":"Orange, CA","url":"http://www.indeed.com/viewjob?jk=4ebc33db00df65f4&qd=oN6Tiwd0J1vf3zcYzp9hkb0tHaPN0YKORpUezna7LFZMqeh1M2z8v-jv-RTAARcYLIBJcLo09CdPumvN3a4WpbejBWse83BT3IcnF0kBcyaptQI94s5DsPOzRyYMc52A&indpubnum=4583798790245950&atk=1au0ucot9av4i8qs","source":"indeed","tags":["developer"],"$$hashKey":"object:363","active":false},{"date":1475251073000,"title":"Frontend Developer (m/w)","company":"Smartfrog Services GmbH","content":"

We’re looking for talented and motivated people to join our team!

Smartfrog is a tech startup focused on the “Internet of Things”, which is about making everyday objects more intelligent and connected to the internet, enabling the user to access them from anywhere at any time. We want the latest technologies to be affordable and user-friendly, so that our everyday lives become more comfortable, more efficient and more secure. Are you the kind of person who gets excited by new challenges? Do you want to help us find innovative solutions to those challenges? If so, we look forward to hearing from you.

What we offer

  • A dynamic office environment at an international tech startup in the heart of Berlin
  • The chance to help build an exciting new brand and develop new products
  • A young and agile business with flat hierarchies
  • Great potential to develop your career
  • Flexible hours and working arrangements
  • Attractive compensation package

Location: Berlin Start: ASAP; Fulltime

Your role

  • Work closely with our Marketing and Design team to design and implement projects, landing pages, etc. Provide technical feedback and inputs
  • Work closely to the Product Development team to provide the best assets for future features. Provide design- related input and feedback
  • Build responsive webpages, based on PSD mockups within our technical framework
  • Release and deploy projects independently to production
  • Maintain and continuously optimize existing pages to improve reach and conversion

Requirements

  • 2+ years proven working experience in digital projects
  • Good skills in HTML5/CSS3, working with authoring framework like Bootstrap/Foundation
  • Good skills with Javascript (jQuery functions) and Node.js (Gulp, Express)
  • Experience with website analytics tools (e.g GA, GTM)
  • Good sense of design and communication
  • Experience with Git version control (Github, pull request)
  • English speaking
","url":"http://jobs.github.com/positions/8d4ef796-8726-11e6-9de2-7ba6baebf868","source":"github","tags":["javascript","developer","node"],"$$hashKey":"object:1243","active":false},{"date":1475185898000,"title":"Web Developer","company":"Electric Pulp","content":"

Since 1996, Electric Pulp has focused on developing cutting-edge interactive solutions. We’re looking for a Web Developer who can help us continue to produce top-of-the-line digital experiences for our clients. So if you're great at what you do, and what you do happens to be front-end development, we want to hear from you.

We prefer that you are or could be local to Sioux Falls, SD, but don’t let your location stop you from making contact. We understand that the right fit might not live here. We do need you to be a U.S. resident, however.

About The Job
As a Web Developer at Electric Pulp, you'll be integral to the success of the project, working with our designers and project managers to implement designs and ensure they're carried successfully through to completion. You'll be using HTML, CSS and JavaScript to accommodate the ever-growing list of viewports and browsers in play.

While coding is the core function of this role, there are a few other things we'll be looking for:

  • Ability to work well with others
  • Self-starter tendencies (especially important if you're out of the area)
  • Dedication required to meet a deadline
  • Interest in and proven history of learning new methods and technologies
  • Ability to write effectively and without typos

This position is available now and is already loaded with work, so you'll need to hit the ground running. We want someone looking to grow and improve, but we need you to have skill from day one.

Things You Should Have

  • 2+ years of experience
  • Expert knowledge of standards-compliant HTML5 & CSS3 (& preprocessors) as well as Responsive (RWD) techniques and methods
  • Experience with JavaScript (jQuery, React.js, pure, something else)
  • Sketch/Photoshop proficiencyExperience with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress)
  • Familiarity with PHP frameworks (e.g., Laravel)
  • Familiarity with front-end frameworks (e.g., Bootstrap)
  • Familiarity with ecommerce platforms helpful (e.g., Magento)
  • Knowledge of version control (Git)
  • Understanding of onsite SEO and content hierarchy
  • Understanding of accessibility best practices
  • Understanding that code needs to work across devices/browsers

Cheat Mode / Real Talk

It's tough to list things we want you to be into. Familiar with Bower? Great! It's not a deal breaker, though. Have experience with Magento or React? YOU NEED TO SHOUT THAT AT US RIGHT NOW. We're flexible, though. Tell us what you're good at.

This is a full-time position with benefits.

  • Paid time off for vacations or illness
  • Excellent health insurance (company pays full single rate)
  • Vision / Dental insurance
  • Disability insurance
  • SimpleIRA Retirement account with company match
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Laptop provided
  • Competitive Ping Pong environment
  • Things to drink

We're very serious about our work, but the team is cool, the projects are fulfilling and the Fridays allow for casual attire. As do the other days.

Send us your resumé and your github repo or examples of your work in the wild. We look forward to hearing from you.

","url":"https://authenticjobs.com/jobs/28102/web-developer","source":"authenticjobs","location":"Remote","tags":["javascript","developer","designer","react","manager"],"$$hashKey":"object:1936","active":false},{"date":1475361487000,"title":"UI Engineer -","company":"Primer","content":"Primer is a customer acquisition tool for mobile apps that puts the entire user experience, from ad impression to purchase, into a performance marketer’s hands.

Our team started as growth consultants, and while working with clients, we noticed that users abandon mobile apps when the specific need that brought that user into the app is neglected in favor of a one-size-fits-all experience. This translates into low conversion rates and difficulty acquiring users through paid channels.

Now, we’re building the tool that will solve this problem.

Primer automatically creates custom purchase funnels for every ad. Marketers can measure the effectiveness of these custom experiences and test or change them anytime – without writing code, involving engineers, or waiting for an app release. Primer empowers marketers to give users what they want.




CHALLENGES




    • Build world-class user experiences that delight users

    • Tackle tough design and product problems and create elegant solutions

    • Work cross-functionally across design and engineering to create an amazing UI







SKILLS




    • 2+ years of experience in developing web UI applications

    • Expertise in JavaScript, CSS, HTML across multiple browsers and operating systems

    • Familiarity writing object-oriented code and programming concepts.

    • Significant experience in developing AJAX-enabled web applications

    • Experience with version control systems such as git

    • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience







PERKS




    • Great SF location in the heart of SOMA - close to public transportation (Bart/Muni/Ferries) - restaurants/nightlife

    • Competitive salaries with early-stage stock options

    • 100% Health, Dental and Vision premiums paid for the employees and DEPENDENTS!

    • Flexible work schedule which includes life/work balance

    • Pick your own equipment including a pair of Bose headphones

    • Free lunches with the team

    • Friendly dogs are allowed in the office

    • Public transit reimbursement

Apply on the Bucks website

The Full-time Front End Web Developer will be responsible for developing and maintaining the front ends of various web presences. He or she should be well versed in the web front-end suite of tools and languages (HTML, CSS, and JavaScript), with particular strength in the area of JavaScript front-end frameworks. The incumbent must be able to recognize opportunities to implement sophisticated front-end web tools, frameworks, and workflows as well as being able to actually follow through with those plans.

Duties:

  • Keep various web presences up to date with latest front-end trends and practices.
  • Stay up to date with latest trends and practices. Keep web team updated on these items as well.
  • Identify opportunities to implement sophisticated front-end tools and workflows.
  • Troubleshooting issues that arise within current environment.
  • Develop and maintain front-end systems and workflows.
  • Update/maintain website content.
  • Assist in other technical areas as needed.

Bucks County Community College offers an exceptional benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, prescription, 403B retirement plan, life insurance, short & long-term disability, generous paid time off, tuition waivers, tuition assistance, summer hours, wellness center, full service cafeteria and free parking on a beautiful Bucks County campus.

Minimum Requirements Include:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • 1-3 years job related experience.
  • Proven, applied understanding of current practices in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Demonstrable evidence of extensive work in the area of JavaScript front end frameworks.
  • Working knowledge of web accessibility practices, including Section 508 and WCAG 2.0.
  • Ability to recognize opportunities for using new tools, practices, workflows, etc. and ability to communicate those opportunities effectively.
  • Preference given to bachelors in computer science, related field, or associates degree with equivalent experience.
  • Ability to code fluently using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

Apply on the Bucks website

","url":"http://jobs.github.com/positions/5680824a-896d-11e6-9717-d1a4c0f71e03","source":"github","tags":["javascript","developer"],"$$hashKey":"object:171","active":false},{"date":1475498832000,"title":"Junior Full-Stack Developer","company":"Knack","location":"Remote","content":"

We’re looking for a junior full-stack JavaScript programmer to help expand the feature set for our database application builder product. Knack is a huge product that touches on all things data: you’ll have a huge developer playground to dive right in and make a major impact.

What You’ll Do

  • Contribute! We want our engineers to make an impact on the Knack product. This means you’re not just implementing features that have been specified to death. It includes developing ideas, making suggestions, and keeping on top of new tech to understand how we can best leverage those to constantly improve the product.
  • Engage your passion! We have enough areas of need where we want to leverage what you’re excited about and use that to make Knack a better product.
  • Program every day and publish many times every week.
  • Evaluate existing code and redesign for increased performance and reliability.
  • Help develop features missing from the current app to make Knack the go-to place for building online databases.

Our Stack

  • JavaScript
  • MongoDB
  • Solr
  • jQuery, Backbone
  • AWS
  • Github

What We’re Looking For

  • Efficiency and productivity, i.e. the ability to get sh!# done.
  • Great communication. If you like to go off to your bunker and only pop up on occasion this won’t work.
  • An independent and versatile hacker, with the ability to pick up different languages, frameworks and techniques with relative ease.
  • A practical understanding of what programming is for. Hint: it’s our customers.
  • A very strong foundation of client-side Javascript and Node.js.
  • A desire to be givin big responsibilites and to make the most of those opportunities to jump start your career

The Whole Package

Location: USA. Work remotely from the place where you are happiest and find your inspiration.

Compensation: competitive salary (50k – 80k), 100% remote team, flexible hours, loose vacation policy.

","url":"https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/122266/front-end-developer-eastern-european-candidates-emaratech-fz-llc","source":"stackoverflow","location":"Dubai, United Arab Emirates","tags":["javascript","developer"],"$$hashKey":"object:612","active":false},{"date":1475512983000,"title":"Developer","company":"Work & Co","content":"

Developers at Work & Co work in small, highly collaborative teams to create visionary digital products and experiences that people use everyday. They work closely with designers, product managers, strategists, and QA engineers to concept, prototype, and execute on a range of products. Join us as we help our clients redefine entire industries.

Work & Co’s methodology emphasizes hands-on skills across all departments. Developers are responsible for structuring technology solutions for clients and delivering clean, well-documented code. They bring valuable knowledge about and a passion for established best practices as well as emerging technologies.

Work & Co (work.co) makes the digital products and experiences people use every day. Now in our third year, we have won the attention of some of the smartest brands in the world, including Virgin America, Apple, Chase, and Target. Work & Co has offices in Brooklyn, Portland, and Rio de Janeiro.

What You Can Expect to Do:

  • Develop product solutions that adhere to Responsive Web Design and browser/device compatibility best practices
  • Propose and advocate for clean, functional design systems
  • Debug and troubleshoot written code to deliver only the best possible experiences to users

What We’re After:

  • Hands-on web development experience that includes experience with agile methodologies
  • Strong core JavaScript proficiency, including familiarity with one or more MV* frameworks
  • Solid grasp of HTML and CSS, leveraging CSS pre and post processors like Sass, Compass and Autoprefixer
  • Demonstrated understanding of task runners such as Grunt, Gulp or Webpack
  • Experience using GIT as part of a development team
  • Experience/interest in native app development
  • Strong organizational skills and eye for detail
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts to a variety of audiences
  • Bonus—Personal projects or strong contributions to Open Source projects that show a passion for engineering and products

Our developers create industry-leading digital work for some of the most recognized brands on the planet. The hand-crafted, unique experiences we create leave no room for cookie-cutter coding, so developers must come prepared to innovate on a daily basis. Successful candidates will be pixel perfectionists who are constantly striving to push themselvesand usto the next level.


Primary responsibilities:

  • Create best-in-class experiences for web, mobile, and emerging platforms with a focus on HTML5, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Make projects come alive through interactive elements -- know how to push pixels in a variety of ways including SVG/CSS animations, TweenLite, Polymer, jQuery, or even straight-up Javascript.
  • Integrate with back-end systems, APIs, and SDKs to create rich, data-driven behaviors.
  • Collaborate with colleagues in technical and non-technical roles throughout each projects lifecycle, from concept to timely execution.
  • Maintain a broad knowledge of development trends and emerging technologies, continually looking for the most innovative and efficient approaches.

Benefits


This is a full-time position at our office in downtown Norfolk, VA. Grow offers paid relocation and temporary housing for selected candidates.


Amazing clients and atmosphere come standard, but what youll love most is our close-knit team of inspiring talent, just under 40 of us in total. Were part of a community of like-minded people in the Norfolk / Virginia Beach metro who spend our time creating great work and building culture around uswith lovely beaches, urban amenities, and family-friendly opportunities throughout the region.


Youll start with a full month of paid vacation and holiday leave, including two weeks in which the company pauses operationsone at midsummer, and one at the holidays. A wealth of additional company benefits include health, dental, matching 401k, disability, paid training, and more.

","url":"https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/126101/front-end-developer-grow","source":"stackoverflow","location":"Norfolk, VA","tags":["javascript","developer"],"$$hashKey":"object:322","active":false},{"date":1475430289000,"title":"Full Stack API Developer","company":"Dynamic Signal","content":"

What we do:


We develop a platform that helps companies get information into the hands of their employees in a way they can easily use and share.


Who we are:


We have created a welcoming work environment that fosters collaboration as well as a realistic work-life balance. We are passionate about our product and encourage everyone to bring their unique skills and experiences to make it that much better.


Who you are:


We are looking for a talented problem solver with at least one year of real-world experience to help us develop, troubleshoot, and document our internal and external REST APIs. We use technologies like C#, JSON, and Postman to build manageable and reusable web services for our clients. Roles you will play in a typical day:



  • Advisor: A key part of our APIs is exposing them for our customers to use. We make this possible by documenting them and creating useful examples.


  • Programmer: Our APIs are used by our member-facing website, mobile apps, and external clients. We build our systems using C# so experience with a robust, type-safe, object-oriented language is a plus.


  • Investigator: Do you like getting to the bottom of a problem? Our APIs play a central role in how all of our systems interact so switching gears and tracking down potential bugs can come at a moment’s notice.


Do you want to become intimately familiar with the finer points of OAuth? Do you dream about crafting a response object that will work in the future as well as right this moment? If you enjoy helping out by having a keen awareness of all the major components (and not just a single silo) then you will be a great fit on our team.


Bonus points:


Want to earn some serious bonus points? What better way to show interest in an API developer position than to actually make some API calls? Feel free to check out what positions we have available and apply for one that you like by sending a GET request to http://api.dynamicsignal.com/jobs and going from there.

","url":"https://stackoverflow.com/jobs/123618/full-stack-api-developer-dynamic-signal","source":"stackoverflow","location":"San Bruno, CA","tags":["developer","full stack"],"$$hashKey":"object:287","active":false},{"date":1475527244000,"title":"Front End Developer","company":"GLAMSQUAD","content":"

You will join GLAMSQUAD as a Front-End Software Engineer on a small team of dedicated engineers. Currently running as a full-feature IOS app and website with a dedicated back-end, we are expanding our client reach and feature set to support our growing business. This is an outstanding opportunity to learn, work with a proven development team and get involved with various projects and technologies.


We are interested in full time employees and long-term contractors (October - March).


You have a passion for web development and a strong background in building highly dynamic & responsive websites using HTML5, CSS3, Javascript and Angular. You will be in charge of implementing web UIs for our internal web application (HTML/CSS/Angular/Bootstrap), website (HTML/SASS/Angular) and cross-platform mobile development (HTML/CSS/Cordova/Angular/Ionic). You will take output from the product team and implement the designs with functional and responsive results. You can provide insight and guidance on UX/UI implementation, best practices and tools. We look for self-starters who thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment and that show an eagerness to learn new technologies as the need arises.


You must show examples of complex web UIs that you developed to be considered. Demonstrating a mix of brand-centric web work and application development is preferred.



Benefits:



  • Competitive salary + equity

  • Medical, vision, and dental insurance

  • Open vacation policy

Advertising Specialty Institute (ASI) is seeking a highly-motivated Front-End Engineer to join our growing team.  We are looking for someone who has a passion for coding inside the browser; leveraging the latest web technologies: HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript frameworks/libraries (like AngularJS, jQuery, ReactJS, etc.).


You will work directly with other members of the product development and user experience team to build complex web applications and push the vision forward.  You will get to work in a challenging and cutting-edge environment where you will be encouraged to refine your skills, share your ideas, and test your creative boundaries.  If clean, maintainable code keeps you sane, and you enjoy talking about web development and AngularJS, then this job is right for you.
